intro: Galliaria scabra, commonly known as the rough galliaria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its rough, hairy stems and small, clustered leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, and it produces small, round fruits. Galliaria scabra is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
